subject: Business
title: What Is a Supply Chain?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is a Supply Chain?.

hook.text: Your morning coffee traveled 6,000 miles â€” from an Ethiopian farm to your cup. The journey is the supply chain.

buildup.text: A supply chain is every step from raw materials to the finished product in a customer's hands.

discovery.text: It includes suppliers, manufacturers, distributors, retailers, and all the transport connecting them.

twist.text: Most consumers never see the supply chain. But when it breaks â€” empty shelves, delayed deliveries â€” everyone notices.

climax.text: COVID exposed how fragile global supply chains are. One factory shutdown in China emptied stores worldwide.

punchline.text: You don't think about the supply chain until it stops working.

quiz.question: What does a supply chain include?
options: Every step from raw materials to the finished product reaching the customer
Only the transportation between warehouse and store
